text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

IRM 3.43.405 provides information for the evaluation of measured employees using the Measured Employees Performance System (MEPS). In addition, this IRM includes Release Recall ranking procedures and Release Recall Listing processing guidelines for seasonal, term, and career/career conditional intermittent employees.
MATERIAL CHANGES

All subsections of this Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) have been revised to provide current MEPS procedures, provide current information on MEPS Reports, and provide managers with tools to utilize updated MEPS screens and reports available through the EQSP (Embedded Quality Submission Processing) system and tools to interpret data available through MEPS; IRM 3.43.405 subsections are renumbered based on the revisions. Major revisions, additions, and deletions in subsections are listed below.

3.43.405.1.2(10) - Updated link to iManage and removed reference and link to obsolete Administrative Procedures for Managers Website. (IPU 15U0625 issued 04/03/2015 - prior was IRM 3.43.405.1.6(2) and (3).
3.43.405.1.4(3) - Added MEPS Control-D Report Names and Job Names on MEPS report run schedule table and provided current information on each report’s scheduled run.
3.43.405.1.7 Functional Responsibilities - Added managers’ functional responsibilities.
3.43.405.5.3 - Clariﬁed All efficiency base points are subject to systemic review and deletion after the last weekly processing of the quarter.

3.43.405.4 Learning Curve - Added additional subsections for Learning Curve Sampling, Learning Curve Status (with an explanation of learning curve monitoring tools and subsections for Learning Curve Sampling Report, Learning Curve Search, Team Learning Curve Report, Learning Curve on Individual Performance Reports, and the Manage Employee Program screen),and Learning Curve Employee Notiﬁcation.
- Provides instructions for managers to keep an employee initialed and dated copy of Single Event Sample Pull Report that notiﬁes the employee of a last learning curve sample.

3.43.405.5.1 Individual Performance Reports and Management Responsibility - Added subsection listing managements responsibilities relating to reviewing and verifying employee data on Performance Reports.
- Added subsections describing Weekly Individual Performance Reports.
- Added subsections describing Ad-Hoc Individual Performance Reports.

3.43.405.7.2 - Added instructions for manager to keep an employee initialed and dated copy of a Single Event Sample Pull Report for any Individual Performance Review type with defect(s) identiﬁed (serves as a record that the employee received notiﬁcation of the quality review results).
3.43.405.7.2.1 Team Defect - Added subsection for Team Defect Review with deﬁnitions, examples, and coding instructions for multiple identical defects and procedural or systemic defects.
3.43.405.7.5 Sampling Log/Pull Sheets - Add subsection with requirement for maintaining a log and included required elements.

3.43.405.8 Quality Adjustments - Added subsection with directions for completing quality adjustments within the EQSP system, an explanation of the Status Filed on the EQSP Search Results screen and the new “Modiﬁed” status.

3.43.405.9 Mid-Quarter/Quarterly Efficiency Report - Provided management with directions for utilizing the mid-quarterly report as a tool to identity issues and actions required and provided systemic base point revision criteria based on the Quarterly Report.

3.43.405.10 Mid-Quarter/Quarterly Quality Report - Clariﬁed report generates at mid-quarter as well as quarterly, clariﬁed report should be used for monitoring quality and provided management with monitoring suggestions.

3.43.405.11 Measured Performance Plan Rating Statistics Reports - Includes details of the updated ﬁelds on the Operation rating Statistics by Team Report, Service Center Rating Statistics by Operation Report and National Rating Statistics by Service Center Report.

3.43.405.12 Other Monitoring Reports - Created subsections that includes an explanation and description the “Weekly No Volume OFP Report”, “EMF 3-Coded Employees Report”, “Grade Mismatch Listing”, “Missing Employees Report”, and “Minimally Successful and Below
Release Recall - Includes complete instructions for Release and Recall procedures and for creating Release Recall Listings utilizing the updated EQSP Release Recall screens.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

IRM 3.43.405, Integrated Management System, dated June 24, 2011 (effective October 01, 2011, is IRM Procedural Update (IPU) 15U0625 issued April 03, 2015 and valid updates addressed in IPU issued July 13, 2013 are incorporated into this IRM.
AUDIENCE

Wage and Investment (W&I) Submission Processing MEPS coordinators, managers of measured employees, quality managers, and local NTEU chapter MEPS coordinators; additionally, Technical advisors and managers of employees subject to periodic release and recall in all areas of the Internal Revenue Service (IRS).
Linda J. Brown Acting Director, Submission Processing Wage and Investment Division

) IRS EOD - The date an employee entered on duty with IRS, modiﬁed to include any prior IRS service. The IRS EOD date is not adjusted for time in Federal Service outside of IRS. (

) Learning Curve - A speciﬁed number of samples containing a speciﬁed of documents within each sample to ensure employees receive quality feedback on each OFP(parent) worked. Work processed on the not be part of any evaluative data until the learning curve has been met. (

) Low Hour Restriction - Data is excluded from the calculated base point if employee works an OFP fewer than ten hours unless on average the employee works more than two hours per week on that OFP. This applies to efficiency only. (

) Measurable Work, Quality - Work is considered measurable when it is performed by an employee assigned to a measured performance plan for quality, the OF has Numerical Performance Standards, the employee completed learning curve requirements for the OFP(parent),quality review results are reported, and volume is reported for the OFP reviewed. (

) Measurable Work, Efficiency - Work is considered measurable when it is performed by an employee assigned to a measured performance plan for ciency, the OFP has Numerical Performance Standards, volume is and the employee has completed the Learning Curve for the OFP(parent) measured in quality). (

) Measured Employees Performance System (MEPS) - An automated designed to provide measured ratings for Quality and/or Efficiency for and below employees who are assigned to a Measured Performance Plan one or both of the measurable critical elements (quality and/or efficiency). Employees are measured based on comparing actual performance to Numerical Performance Standards which are provided to employees before work is performed. (

) Median - If calculating an odd number of historical rates by OFP, it is the middle production rate. If calculating an even number of historical rates by OFP, it is the average of the two middle rates. (

) Numerical Performance Standard - A value against which employee perfor- mance is measured. It is expressed as the mean (average) Percent (Quality) or as the median number of Documents Per Hour (Efficiency). Internal Revenue Manual

) - At a minimum, at least six employees on a measured mance plan in efficiency must have completed the learning curve and time and volume to a speciﬁc/established OFP in a quarter with numerical formance standards to be measurable. They must also meet the low hour restriction. (
) SEID - Standard Employee Identiﬁer is the ﬁve digit code that uniquely ties employees to their data without using their Social Security Number. (

) Sixty Day Annual CJE Counter - The period of time an employee on a measured performance plan must be on measured CJEs (quality and/or effi- ciency) during their rating period before they can receive a measured rating. ) A performance plan describes the critical elements of an employee’s job and the performance expectations for those elements. (
) A Critical Job Element (CJE) is an important part of the job; an employee’s failure to perform a CJE at a minimum standard constitutes unacceptable formance by the employee. (
) Employees assigned to CJE Performance Plans may either be bargaining or non-bargaining unit, as long as they are not managers or management officials. (
) The CJE Performance Plans also contain the Retention Standard for the Fair and Equitable Treatment of Taxpayers. (

) Depending upon the position, some CJEs may or may not be measured; identiﬁed by the type of performance plan assigned. There are two types performance plans: • Measured Performance Plan. • Unmeasured Performance Plan. (
) The Unmeasured Performance Plan provides the guidelines for evaluating employees performing unmeasured work. (
) Unmeasured Performance Plans are assigned to employees when all are considered unmeasurable; neither volume reported (efficiency) nor reviewed (quality) are considered measurable. (
) Few Submission Processing employees are unmeasured in MEPS most employees can be measured in at least one CJE – Quality. (

) For Performance Management System (PMS) purposes, employees by MEPS are assigned to performance plans that describe the CJEs and performance expectations for those elements. The Measured Performance Plan provides the guidelines for evaluating employees performing work. (

) Measured Performance Plans include CJEs that can be measured against performance standards. These CJEs are: • Business Results - Quality: the quality of work performed can be mined by quality review results. • Business Results - Efficiency: the employee’s efficiency can be by time and volume reported for work completed (documents per hour (DPH)). (

An alpha character indicator (base point indicator code) may be located next to a base point (quality and/or efficiency) if the base point was changed after 16 days prior to the beginning of the quarter they cover. The alpha character indicates the following action for that base point:
Added; the base point did not calculate from the same quarter, previous year.
Deleted (lowered to zero); the base point was deleted after the quarter begins.
Raised; the base point was set higher than the calculated base point before the quarter begins.
Lowered; the base point was set lower than the calculated base point before the quarter begins or the set base point was lowered after the quarter begins.

The process of selecting a portion of completed work for review is called sampling. Random sampling is the process of choosing a sample in such a way that all completed work has the same chance of being included in the sample regardless of when the work is completed. When quality review results for an OF produces an accuracy rate of

% higher, the work is considered High Quality Work (HQW) and is quality reviewed as High Quality Function (HQF). HQW does not require the same degree of sampling as work producing a lower accuracy rate. Therefore, is sampled as OF/Product Review review rather than Individual Quality Resources are saved and focus can be directed to OFs with lower quality accuracy rates. Individual review samples must be pulled across the week with at least four samples per week for each employee. Product Review (HQW Review) samples should be pulled each day but at a minimum of

days per week. Quality Reviewers record review results in the EQSP system. Review should be input timely for each week ending (weeks run Sunday through Saturday). Review results must be entered and the review completed by Wednesday of the subsequent week in order for quality results to appear on the employee’s weekly IPR.

) Team Defect Review is used when a defective document(s) identiﬁed in an employee’s sample of completed work is recorded to the team rather than to the individual. (

) Team defects include: • Multiple identical defects removed from the employee’s sample. • Procedural or systemic defects removed from the employee’s sample. Note: Team defects are not included as documents reviewed for an employee; therefore, they are not included in an employee’s measured performance sample. Team Defects are included in the accuracy rate calculations of the Team, Department, Operation, and Site. (

) Defects are considered multiple identicals when a quality reviewer identiﬁes the same error on every document that the opportunity for error is available within the sample. Multiple identical defects are entered into EQSP as • One defect is considered as Individual Quality Review for the employee. • The remaining like defect(s) are considered Team Defect Review(s) for team. • All defects are considered Individual Quality Review for the employee if least one document within the sample with the same opportunity for is worked correctly. • Any additional defect(s) identiﬁed within the sample that is not a multiple identical is considered Individual Performance Review for the employee. ) To create a release recall: • Click “Create Release Recall”; the Create Release Recall Request generates with ﬁelds available for Organization, Class Code, and Week Ending. • Enter the Organization, Class Code, and select the Week Ending from drop down list. Note: Only weeks ending after the most recent release recall created for the requested Org Code available for selection with a maximum of eight week ending dates. Release Recall should always be run for the most current week available. • Click “Save”; a conﬁrmation screen appears conﬁrming the Release was created for the Week Ending, Service Center, Organization, and Code entered.
